This function computes several types of entropy of ordinal patterns as well as the Fisher information measure. It combines the *HFisher*, *HRenyi*, *HShannon*, and *HTsallis* functions from the *StatOrdPattHxC* package and rewrites them using Object Oriented Programming. The examples below are taken from *StatOrdPattHxC*.

### Arguments 

#### 1. p (Required)

A probability function

#### 2. method (Optional)

A character string specifying the entropy type or information measure to calculate.
The available options are as follows:

- "Fisher"
- "Renyi"
- "Shannon"
- "Tsallis"

The default is "Fisher". The equation for each is provided below.

#### 3. beta (Optional)

Used in the calculations of the Renyi and Tsallis entropies. Default is 1.5.

#### Returns

A value in [0,1]



### Examples

```{r setup, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(ordpatt2)

# Time series
set.seed(1234567890, kind="Mersenne-Twister")
x <- rnorm(1000) # white noise
y <- ordpatt2::mov.av(x, order=51) # smoothed with moving averages

# Ordinal Patterns
op.wn.4 <- OPprob2(x, emb=4)
op.ma.4 <- OPprob2(y, emb=4)


```
